verses.roman:
parera dravya tumi kene cāha vināśite?
dharmādharma vicāra kibā nā pāra karite?

synonyms: parera dravya—another's property; tumi—you; kene—why; cāha—want; vināśite—to destroy; dharma-adharma—what is pious and what is impious; vicāra—consideration; kibā—why; nā—not; pāra—you can; karite—do.
translation: "Why should you want to destroy another's property? Can't you consider what is right and wrong?
